title: Mets swap salary proposals with Davis, Murphy
body: The Mets swapped 2013 salary proposals with first baseman Ike Davis and second baseman Daniel Murphy, the club's lone remaining arbitration-eligible players, ahead of Friday's deadline to do so.  According to multiple reports, Davis is asking for $3.7 million and the Mets have proposed $2.825 million. Murphy, meanwhile, asked for $3.4 million and was offered $2.55 million.  Davis, 25, hit .227 with 32 home runs and 90 RBIs over a career-best 156 games in 2012, while making approximately $506,000. Paul Casella is a reporter for MLB.com. Follow him on Twitter @paul_casella. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Paul Casella
